register.description: Return to the . This register holds the IP identifier.

bitfield.description: Unique IP identifier within Cadence IP portfolio

register.description: Return to the . The read-only Configuration Status Register 0 indicates the hardware configuration options chosen for implementation of the I3C-Master.

bitfield.description: CMD Resp MEM depth coded into 3 bits.
Returns the value of User GPO
Returns the value of User GPI
IBI Resp MEM depth coded into 2 bits.
Returns status of Device Role [Main/Secondary Master].
Returns the number of retaining registers for I3C Slave devices [Addresses and Characteristics], the max value is 11.

register.description: Return to the . The read-only Configuration Status Register 1 indicates the hardware configuration options chosen for implementation of the I3C-Master.

bitfield.description: CMD FIFO depth coded into 3 bits.
SLV DDR RX FIFO depth coded into 5 bits.
SLV DDR TX FIFO depth coded into 5 bits.
IBI FIFO depth coded into 3 bits.
RX FIFO depth coded into 5 bits.
TX FIFO depth coded into 5 bits.

register.description: Return to the . This register gives an information about particular version of the IP.

bitfield.description: VENDOR_ID: IP vendor ID affected to CadenceIP [reset = 0xCAD].
PRODUCT_ID: unique IP identifier within CDNS IP portfolio [reset = 0x13C].

register.description: Return to the . Control Register for Cadence I3C Master IP - register that provides main control and configuration options for the controller.

bitfield.description: When set HIGH the I3C-Master is enabled and it can initiates the I3C/I2C transactions.
Manual Command Start writing 1 starts execution of the commands currently in CMD Memories.
Manual Command Start Enable if set 1 the IP will wait with starting of command execution until MCS but [
Enables support for timing parameter that has been changed in v1.1, i.e.
Field that provides option to add data hold delay with respect to the SCL clock on which data on SDA is launched [applied only during actual Data transfer]
This bit controls the HW response for ACK'ed HJ request.
Specifies ACK response type for GETACCMST CCC, it can be either ACK response type [mst_ack = 1] or NACK response type [mst_ack = 0].
Specifies ACK response type for HJ request, it can be either ACK response type [hj_ack = 1] or NACK response type [hj_ack = 0].
Initiate HJ request - applicable only for Secondary master in slave mode.
Initiate Mastership request - applicable only in slave mode.

register.description: Return to the . Prescale settings for SDR/I2C modes

bitfield.description: Prescaler value for I2C SCL clock generation.
Prescaler value for I3C Push-Pull SDR Mode SCL clock generation.

register.description: Return to the . Prescale settings related to Open Drain / Push Pull I3C timings

bitfield.description: Counter for low period of SCL clock for Push Pull in I3C.
Counter for low period of SCL clock for Open Drain in I3C.

register.description: Return to the . The write only Interrupt Enable Register is used to enable interrupts by setting bits in the read only Interrupt Mask Register - Master Mode (). See Interrupt Status Register - Master Mode () description for details on specific interrupt conditions. When any bit is written high, the corresponding interrupt is enabled. Writing a low to any bit has no effect.

Return to the . The write only Interrupt Disable Register is used to disable interrupts by clearing the bits in the read only Interrupt Mask Register - Master Mode (). See Interrupt Status Register - Master Mode () description for details on specific interrupt conditions. When any bit is written high, the corresponding interrupt is disabled. Writing a low to any bit has no effect.

Return to the . This read only register, indicates the current state of the interrupts mask. See Interrupt Status Register - Master Mode () description for details on specific interrupt conditions. A high value indicates the interrupt is enabled to generate an interrupt. A low value indicates the interrupt is disabled from generating an interrupt (masked).
Return to the . Interrupt Clear Register for Master Mode of the cdnsi3c_master controller. Write 1 to clear (change from 1 to 0) corresponding bit in . Writing 0 has no effect
Return to the . Interrupt Status Register for Master Mode of the cdnsi3c_master controller
Return to the . Status Register for Cadence I3C Master IP, meaningful only when controller operates in Master mode.

bitfield.description: Indicates when the core is IDLE and ready to accept new commands.
Indicates current mode of the controller:

register.description: Return to the . Stores status on completion of each command, works on FIFO-basis.

bitfield.description: This field contains the code of an error that has occured during the last transaction.
The number of transferred bytes [SDR] or transferred words [DDR] during the last command.

register.description: Return to the . Stores status of SIR on its completion, works on FIFO-basis.

bitfield.description: If HIGH IBI has been ACKed, NACK response otherwise
ID of a Slave that has issued an IBI request
Set to 1 if IBI Data FIFO overflow has occured during the transaction.
This field contains the type of an IBI.

register.description: Return to the . The write only Interrupt Enable Register is used to enable interrupts by setting bits in the read only Interrupt Mask Register - Slave Mode (). See Interrupt Status Register - Slave Mode () description for details on specific interrupt conditions. When any bit is written high, the corresponding interrupt is enabled. Writing a low to any bit has no effect.

Return to the . The write only Interrupt Disable Register is used to disable interrupts by clearing the bits in the read only Interrupt Mask Register - Slave Mode (). See Interrupt Status Register - Slave Mode () description for details on specific interrupt conditions. When any bit is written high, the corresponding interrupt is disabled. Writing a low to any bit has no effect.

Return to the . This read only register, indicates the current state of the interrupts mask. See Interrupt Status Register - Slave Mode () description for details on specific interrupt conditions. A high value indicates the interrupt is enabled to generate an interrupt. A low value indicates the interrupt is disabled from generating an interrupt (masked).
Return to the . Interrupt Clear Register for Slave Mode of the cdnsi3c_master controller. Write 1 to clear (change from 1 to 0) corresponding bit in . Writing 0 has no effect
Return to the . Interrupt Status Register for Slave Mode of the cdnsi3c_master controller

bitfield.description: This interrupt is triggered whenever I3C-Slave DEFSLVS CCC command is received.
This interrupt is triggered whenever I3C-Slave is not in Test Mode and ENTTM CCC command with byte value of 0x01 [general Test Mode] is received.
This event is triggered whenever SDR Error is detected - applicable for S0, S1, S2, S4 and S5 Errors from MIPI spec.
This event is triggered whenever DISEC CCC or ENEC CCC is received.
This event is triggered whenever Hot-Join request is completed.
This event is triggered whenever Mastership Request is completed.
This event is triggered whenever Dynamic Address of the device has been updated.
This event is triggered whenever fail event during SDR transfer is detected [applicable for Private Write transfers only].
This event is triggered whenever fail event during DDR transfer is detected.
This event is triggered whenever threshold level for DDR Rx DATA Buffer is reached.
This event is triggered whenever threshold level for DDR Tx DATA Buffer is reached.
Set if the host attempts to read from the DDR_RX_FIFO register when there is no more data.
Set if the host attempts to write to DDR_TX_FIFO register more times than the FIFO depth.
This bit is set whenever the Slave terminates the DDR Read transfer.
This bit is set whenever the Master terminates the DDR Write transfer.
This bit is set whenever the Slave terminates the SDR Private Read transfer.
This bit is set whenever the Master terminates the SDR Private Write transfer.

register.description: Return to the . The read only Status 0 register () is provided to enable the continuous monitoring of the raw unmasked status information of the I3C-Master operating in Slave mode.

bitfield.description: Number of transferred bytes in SDR transactions.

register.description: Return to the . The read only Status 1 register () is provided to enable the continuous monitoring of the raw unmasked status information of the I3C-Master operating in Slave mode.

bitfield.description: Bits that indicate current Activity State.
This bit is set whenever MR request is disabled by Current I3C-Master using DISEC CCC.
This bit is set whenever Slave has Dynamic Address assigned.
This bit is set whenever SDR_RX_FIFO is full.
This bit is set whenever SDR_TX_FIFO is full.
This bit is set whenever SDR_RX_FIFO is empty.
This bit is set whenever SDR_TX_FIFO is empty.

register.description: Return to the . Command0 FIFO. When implemented, the commands will be executed sequentially in order of arrival from the FW.

bitfield.description: Defines transfer modes for I3C private read/write commands [not CCC], the following options are available:

register.description: Return to the . Command 1 FIFO. When implemented, the commands will be executed sequentially in order of arrival from the FW.

bitfield.description: COMMAND ID - generated by the host and used by the DMA to sort incoming read data to different consumers [channelization].

register.description: Return to the . Tx Data FIFO which stores number of bytes to be sent with particular command. APB->I3C direction

bitfield.description: Tx Data FIFO which stores number of bytes to be sent with particular command

register.description: Return to the . High priority command register. When the core currently is executing a particular command from the CMD FIFO and new immediate command is sent, the core finish the standard command and then will execute the immediate command, disregarding the CMD FIFO state. Supposed to be used mainly for CCC commands with payload up to 4 bytes.

Return to the . High priority command register. When the core currently is executing a particular command from the CMD FIFO and new immediate command is sent, the core finish the standard command and then will execute the immediate command, disregarding the CMD FIFO state. Supposed to be used mainly for CCC commands with payload up to 4 bytes.

bitfield.description: COMMAND ID - generated by the host and used by the DMA to sort incoming read data to different consumers [channelization].

register.description: Return to the . Payload/Data for a particular immediate command.

bitfield.description: Payload/Data for a particular immediate command.

register.description: Return to the . Rx Data FIFO which stores number of bytes to be received with particular command. I3C->APB direction

bitfield.description: Rx Data FIFO which stores number of bytes to be received with particular command.

register.description: Return to the . IBI Data FIFO which stores number of bytes to be received for particular IBI request when BCR[2]=1 I3C->APB direction

bitfield.description: IBI Data FIFO which stores number of bytes to be received for particular IBI request.

register.description: Return to the . DDR Tx Data FIFO stores number of words to be sent with particular DDR command in slave mode. APB->I3C direction

bitfield.description: DDR Tx Data FIFO stores number of words to be sent with particular DDR command in slave mode

register.description: Return to the . DDR Rx Data FIFO stores number of words to be received with particular DDR command in slave mode. APB->I3C direction

bitfield.description: DDR Rx Data FIFO stores number of words to be received with particular DDR command in slave mode

register.description: Return to the . Configuration register for Command and In-Band Interrupt data buffer thresholds.

bitfield.description: Threshold configuration value for IBI RESP memory block
Threshold configuration value for Command RESP memory block
Threshold configuration value for IBI DATA memory block
Threshold configuration value for Command REQ memory block

register.description: Return to the . Configuration register for Tx and Rx data buffer thresholds.

bitfield.description: Threshold configuration value for Rx Data memory block
Threshold configuration value for Tx Data memory block

register.description: Return to the . Configuration register for Tx and Rx thresholds associated with Slave Mode DDR Data memory blocks.

bitfield.description: Threshold configuration value for Slave Mode DDR Rx Data memory block
Threshold configuration value for Slave Mode DDR Tx Data memory block

register.description: Return to the . Control register for FIFO soft flush control

bitfield.description: When asserted while controller is disabled, the IBI Response Queue read/write pointers will be set to 0, effectively make the FIFO empty.
When asserted while controller is disabled, the Command Response Queue read/write pointers will be set to 0, effectively make the FIFO empty.
When asserted while controller is disabled, the SLV DDR Rx Data memory block read/write pointers will be set to 0, effectively make the FIFO empty.
When asserted while controller is disabled, the SLV DDR Tx Data memory block read/write pointers will be set to 0, effectively make the FIFO empty.
When asserted while controller is disabled, the immediate command/data register will be cleared.
When asserted while controller is disabled, the IBI data memory block read/write pointers will be set to 0.
When asserted while controller is disabled, the Rx Data memory block read/write pointers will be set to 0.
When asserted while controller is disabled, the Tx Data memory block read/write pointers will be set to 0.
When asserted while controller is disabled, the command Command memory block read/write pointers will be set to 0.

register.description: Return to the . Prescale settings for First SCL high timeout detection
Return to the . Prescale settings for SCL high and low timeout detection
Return to the . Device control register

bitfield.description: DevID11 is active - has either valid DA or SA.
DevID10 is active - has either valid DA or SA.
DevID9 is active - has either valid DA or SA.
DevID8 is active - has either valid DA or SA.
DevID7 is active - has either valid DA or SA.
DevID6 is active - has either valid DA or SA.
DevID5 is active - has either valid DA or SA.
DevID4 is active - has either valid DA or SA.
DevID3 is active - has either valid DA or SA.
DevID2 is active - has either valid DA or SA.
DevID1 is active - has either valid DA or SA.
DevID0 is active - has either valid DA or SA.

register.description: Return to the . User Defined GPI Word 0: four 8-bits GPI Registers
Return to the . User Defined GPO Word 0: four 8-bits GPO Registers

Return to the . ASF Interrupt Status Register. This register indicates the source of ASF interrupts. The corresponding bit in the mask register must be clear for a bit to be set. If any bit is set in this register the asf_fatal or asf_nonfatal signal will be asserted. Writing to either raw or masked status registers, clear both registers. For test purposes, trigger signal interrupt event by writing to the ASF interrupt status test register.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Configuration and status registers error interrupt
Data and address paths parity error interrupt

register.description: Return to the . ASF Interrupt Raw Status Register. A bit set in this raw register indicates a source of ASF fault in the corresponding feature. Writing to either raw or masked status registers, clear both registers. For test purposes, trigger signal interrupt event by writing to the ASF interrupt status test register.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Configuration and status registers error interrupt
Data and address paths parity error interrupt

register.description: Return to the . The ASF interrupt mask register indicating which interrupt bits in the ASF interrupt status register are masked. All bits are set at reset. Clear the individual bit to enable the corresponding interrupt.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Mask bit for integrity error interrupt
Mask bit for protocol error interrupt.
Mask bit for transaction timeouts error interrupt.
Mask bit for configuration and status registers error interrupt.
Mask bit for data and address paths parity error interrupt.
Mask bit for SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt.
Mask bit for SRAM correctable error interrupt.

register.description: Return to the . The ASF interrupt test register emulate hardware even. Write one to individual bit to trigger single event in (masked and raw) status registers according to mask and will generate interrupt accordingly.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Test bit for integrity error interrupt
Test bit for protocol error interrupt.
Test bit for transaction timeouts error interrupt.
Test bit for configuration and status registers error interrupt.
Test bit for data and address paths parity error interrupt.
Test bit for SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt.
Test bit for SRAM correctable error interrupt.

register.description: Return to the . The fatal or non-fatal interrupt register selects whether a fatal (asf_int_fatal) or non-fatal (asf_int_nonfatal) interrupt is triggered. If the bit of the event will be set to one then fatal interrupt (asf_int_fatal) will be triggered. Otherwise the non-fatal interrupt (asf_int_nonfatal) will be triggered.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Enable integrity error interrupt as fatal
Enable protocol error interrupt as fatal.
Enable transaction timeouts error interrupt as fatal.
Enable configuration and status registers error interrupt as fatal.
Enable data and address paths parity error interrupt as fatal.
Enable SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt as fatal.
Enable SRAM correctable error interrupt as fatal.

register.description: Return to the . Status register for SRAM correctable fault. These fields are updated whenever asf_sram_corr_fault input is active.

bitfield.description: Last SRAM instance that generated fault.
Last SRAM address that generated fault.

register.description: Return to the . Status register for SRAM uncorrectable fault. These fields are updated whenever asf_sram_uncorr_fault input is active.

bitfield.description: Last SRAM instance that generated fault.
Last SRAM address that generated fault.

register.description: Return to the . Statistics register for SRAM faults. Note that this register clears when software writes to any field.

bitfield.description: Count of number of uncorrectable errors if implemented.
Count of number of correctable errors if implemented.

register.description: Return to the . Control register to configure the ASF transaction timeout monitors.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Timer value to use for transaction timeout monitor.

register.description: Return to the . Control register to mask out ASF transaction timeout faults from triggering interrupts. On reset, all bits are set to mask out all sources. Clear the corresponding bit to enable the interrupt source. The width of this field is parameterizable and the bit definitions are implementation specific.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Mask bit for apb transaction timeout fault.
Mask bit for I3C transaction SCL low timeout fault.
Mask bit for I3C transaction SCL high timeout fault.
Mask bit for I3C transaction first SCL high timeout fault.

register.description: Return to the . Status register for transaction timeouts fault. If a fault occurs the relevant status bit will be set to 1. Each bit can be cleared by software writing 1 to each bit.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Status bits for apb transaction timeout fault.
Status bits for I3C transaction SCL low timeout fault.
Status bits for I3C transaction SCL high timeout fault.
Status bits for I3C transaction first SCL high timeout fault.

register.description: Return to the . Control register to mask out ASF Protocol faults from triggering interrupts. On reset, all bits are set to mask out all sources. Clear the corresponding bit to enable the interrupt source. The width of this field is parameterisable and the bit definitions are implementation specific.

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Mask bit for slv_sdr_rd_abort protocol fault source.
Mask bit for slv_ddr_fail protocol fault source.
Mask bit for s5 protocol fault source.
Mask bit for s4 protocol fault source.
Mask bit for s3 protocol fault source.
Mask bit for s2 protocol fault source.
Mask bit for s1 protocol fault source.
Mask bit for s0 protocol fault source.
Mask bit for mst_sdr_rd_abort protocol fault source.
Mask bit for mst_ddr_fail protocol fault source.
Mask bit for m2 protocol fault source.
Mask bit for m1 protocol fault source.
Mask bit for m0 protocol fault source.

register.description: Return to the . Status register for protocol faults. If a fault occurs the relevant status bit will be set to 1. Each bit can be cleared by software writing 1 to each bit

bitfield.description: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.
Status bit for slv_sdr_rd_abort protocol fault.
Status bit for slv_ddr_fail protocol fault.
Status bit for s5 protocol fault.
Status bit for s4 protocol fault.
Status bit for s3 protocol fault.
Status bit for s2 protocol fault.
Status bit for s1 protocol fault.
Status bit for s0 protocol fault.
Status bit for mst_sdr_rd_abort protocol fault.
Status bit for mst_ddr_fail protocol fault.
